results.title: Iatrogenic angioedema associated with ACEi, sitagliptin, and deficiency of 3 enzymes catabolizing bradykinin.
results.text_hl: A case is described of Angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor (ACEi) and @CHEMICAL_Sitagliptin_Phosphate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068900 @@@sitagliptin@@@ induced @DISEASE_Angioedema @DISEASE_MESH:D000799 @@@angioedema@@@, where @<m>DISEASE_Atelosteogenesis_type_1</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C535396 @@@AO@@@ attacks decreased after the withdrawal of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ but resolved only after the withdrawal of @CHEMICAL_Sitagliptin_Phosphate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068900 @@@sitagliptin@@@, an inhibitor of dipeptylpeptidase IV.

citations.NLM: Beaudouin E, Defendi F, Picaud J, Drouet C, Ponard D, Moneret-Vautrin DA. Iatrogenic angioedema associated with ACEi, sitagliptin, and deficiency of 3 enzymes catabolizing bradykinin. Eur Ann Allergy Clin Immunol. 2014 May;46(3):119-22. PMID: 24853572
